dialogues.text: I read books to them. I write letters. Tell ‘em some jokes. It helps me tco. Because ever since my last wife - well, you must have heard.

dialogues.text: Yeah. I was sorry to hear about that. I heard she went very quickly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIX

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: So what is that now? Three divorces?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Well, listen, you just had bad Luck with your personality.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You want me to stop the car and look?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (smiles) Nah... But we should turn off here. I have to eat. It’s a low sugar condition. <= have to eat every four hours.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX

dialogues.speaker: DAY

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Here. Make out a timetable when you eat, when you pee, when you fart, when you sleep and when you cry. Because that was the last time I’m pulling off the Freeway, you hear?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR

dialogues.text: (holds up glass of water) Lecal water? From around here? You know how many pesticides they have in local water?

dialogues.text: w ry

dialogues.text: Jesus, open a window, willya? Felix opens the window and waves the smoke our.

dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.text: I’m going to try to stay very calm through the next sentence I'm going to say... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
FELIX (CONT’D) If it’s not ia the trunk, WHERE THE

And if I did go back, we'd have to make three stops for you to pee, to get locked in the john, to pay another kid another five bucks and then we’d stop for you to eat again, take your pills and then tell me what you‘ve been doing with your life for the last seventeen years, does that answer your question? Felix turns, walks away and sits under a tree and sulks. Oscar crosses to him. OSCAR (CONT’D) So what'd you have in there? Two shirts, two pairs of socks, an ironing board and a tube of spot remover? I'll pay you back.

dialogues.text: (his eyes look up) In that suitcase is the black afternoon formal suit I bought to wear when I give my daughter away in Marriage. In the suitcase was the six thousand dollar silver Tiffany tray I bought as a wedding gift. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

(2) . au FELIX (CONT‘D) In that suitease, was ten thousand dollars in cash I intended to give to my son-in-law on his wedding day. Now in your suitcase, the police will find your broken, smashed, mutilated and dissected body in the event that you don‘t go back and find my_fucking suitcase..

dialogues.text: Come on. Get back in the car. If it’s still there, they have new things today that get them to you fast. Like Federal Express or U.P.S. or er... er a fax.

dialogues.text: I just want to know why... why, when you get around me, you behave like a goddamn... (pangs top of car with his hand) Idiotic... {bangs it again) Imbecilic... (bangs it again) Total moronic... {bangs it again)

dialogues.text: (on shithead, ne gives in one final bang) The car slowly starts to move backward down the hill. They both stand there transfixed as it rolls faster and further down the hill, over an embankment, crashes, catches fire and explodes. They watch it. Then Felix looks at Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Don's yel> at me.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I wasn’t yelling at you. i'm yelling at the situacion.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Ged, you haven't changed in thirty years, have you?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I don‘t believe this. I haven‘t seen the woman in a half a century and she still hasn’c finished the last fight we had.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Alrigh can everyone stop acting like chiidren here?

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHE
dialogues.text: Children? You chink we’re children? We've been preparing this wedding for three months and you take a casual joy ride to get here? Patronizing women again, Oscar?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Don’t yell at me, Blanche. You got two other husbands here to do that... Felix, can we go in the other room a minute? I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads Felix out into another room and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: How about that Frances? I'd love to divorce her again, =I swear... So what do you think has happened?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: My honest opinion?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: So what are you calling me out here for?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I thought maybe you'd have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I£ L had an idea, I would have called you out here... So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: We'll have to wait and see. The worst that can happen is we'll have to postpone the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Pestrone?? ‘You think 1’ let my daughter be numi front of the whole world because of your ditzy son?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Hey! Watch what you say about my son. Maybe it’s your Hannah that's the wacky one.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Hannah wacky?? My Hannah wacky??

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Stop repeating ict. Sounds like a Hawaiian hotel... One of them caused this, I don’t know which one.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: And I’m saying, if he breaks her heart, that boy will have to deai with me.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Are you threatening to get physical with my kid?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: If that’s what it takes. They are now nose to nose.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Get your nose off my nose before I sneeze your brains into a tiny Kleenex.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: That's ic! Thac‘s it, Oscar... The door opens. We HEAR a helicopter overhead. Frances and Blanche come in.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHE
dialogues.text: They found him.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: They found him? Oscar, they found him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: A police helicopter just spotted him.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Where is he, for God’s sake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see it flying over the house, making low passes.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Looking down, we see the grounds, the quests and now Felix, Oscar, Frances and Blanche and others all lookin up. The copter makes a turn and then swoops down towards the roof. Bruce is sitting on the roof wearing jeans. sneakers, and a T-shirt. He is sitting tightly against the chimney, out of sight of everyone below. He waves off the copter and turns his face away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUY with a builhorn.

dialogues.speaker: BULLHORN
dialogues.text: He‘s on the roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar, Felix and others all rush up the stairs. On the landing.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Which is his room?

dialogues.speaker: BLANCEE
dialogues.text: (points) That one there. They all follow Oscar to the door. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: {to others) This is not a coffee klotsch. He's my son, I'll talk to him alone.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHE
dialogues.text: He’s my son too. He’ll listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Is that why he’s up on the roof? He opens the door slowly and goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar crosses to the open window and leans out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce is still sitting near the chimney.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: {leeking out) Beautiful day, isn‘t it?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I hope you don’t think I’m meddling but... were you planning on coming to the wedding today?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I’m thinking about it. Oscar sits on the sill.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Nervous, heh?. Listen, everyone gets nervous before they get married. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i19 CONTINUED; f 104. OSCAR (CONT'D) . The night before my wedding, =I tried to join the Peace Corps in Kenya.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: .I think I’d be making a big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Because I don’t trust marriage. Look at everyone here. My own family. Mom‘s been married three times. You were married once and then never again for thirty years. Hers were too many and yours not enough. What‘’s wrong with it thac frightens everyone so much?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Well, it’s like baseball. Either you can play or you can’t. I couldn't play and your mother could Play but she kept getting traded all the cime.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: That‘s not the answer I’m looking for.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Then why’d you wait so long to ask the question?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Because it’s what I thought I wanted. Until I saw all the divorcees gather here. And now I know it’s not what I want.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Yes. I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Then get out of it. Don‘t do it, Brucey. Bruce looks at him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 2) . as

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Do you mean it?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Because you'll live your life out regretting this day forever. Get out, Bruce. She’s young, she’s pretty, she‘ll find someone else. But you’re my son. Don‘t do this terrible thing to yourself. Let me go talk to the others, I’ll figure out what to say. He comes in and crosses to the door. Bruce climbs into the room.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: The only thing is. = really iove her.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Sure you love her. Now! So you’ll have two years of excitement and forty-five years of hell. Trust me, Brucey. He. turns to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I'll always love her. She’s the best thing that’s ever happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Would you be willing to gamble your life on that? I know I haven't been there enough for you, Bruce, but this is the. best advice I'll ever give you. Not getting married today is the right thing for you to do.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Maybe right for you, Dad, but it’s wrong for me... Tell everyone I'm getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (relieved) Thank God you said that. I didn’t know how long I could keep up talking like an asshole. They cross to each other, embrace.  120 INT. BEDROOM - DAY ae Hannah, the pride =o be, is being attended to by the dressmaker's (MARIA'S) last minute retouches. Hannah looks ravishing. A KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: (Latinio) Whoever it is, go'’way. ‘We not ready.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (voice through door) Not even for your old man?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Dad? Oh, God!... Maria, let him in. Hurry. Maria crosses =o che door, mumbling to nerseif in Spanish. She opens it. Felix comes in and looks at Hannah. He stops, overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I come back soon. If you smudge her dress, I kill you. She goes, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (misty eyed) Oh, dear God. I have just seen Heaven and it’s in living color.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (beaming) Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I would say ‘yes’ if I could just get the lump out of my throat first. Can I hug you?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You better. Because if you didn’t make it, I would have postponed. They embrace. HANNAH (CONT‘D) Have you seen Bruce? Isn’t he terrific. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Er, yes. I didn’t get a chance to talk to him. He was -- busy.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: On the roof? I know.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: You knew?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I sent him there. He started getting the jitters and I said, “Hey, Bruce. Don’t bother me. Go sleep on the roof. I’ve got more important things to do’.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (smiles) No kidding? Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: So was it a terrible trip?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Well, if you asked me that question four hours ago I would have said, the pits. But something happened on the plane and suddenly everything’s coming up roses.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You met someone?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I'll save it for larer. I don‘t want to keep you... As a matter of fact, I can’t keep you anymore, can

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Well, you could stay closer if you moved to California.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: That's funny. Because I was just thinking about checking out San Francisco. A KNOCK on the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 220 121 108. CONTINUED: (2) —_ FELIX (CONT’D) T‘ll get ic. (starts for the door) Oh. = hope you don’t mind my giving the pride away dressed like this?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You look great to me. He opens the door. Maria comes in.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Mr. Ungar? This suitcase jus’ come for you. Felix, amazed and delighted. takes his suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: On second thought. maybe I’11 spizf it up a bic. He goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wedding is in progress. Felix is wearing his black afternoon formal. Oscar stands behind the now dressed Bruce, with Blanche at his side. Frances stands beside Felix.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE OF PEACE
dialogues.text: ...then with the power vested in me by the state of California, = now pronounce you man and wife. You may kiss the bride. Bruce gives Hannah a loving kiss as the guests APPLAUD and WHISTLE. The fathers give their kids each a kiss. Then Felix gives Frances a kiss on the cheek. Then sneezes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCES
dialogues.text: Still allergic to my perfume?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: No, that’s gone. It just triggered an old memory in my sinuses. He turns and looks for Felice. She sees him and waves. He crosses to her. Oscar kisses Blanche. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 109. CONTINUED: . os

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Blanche.

dialogues.speaker: BLANCHE
dialogues.text: I‘m sorry I yelled at you. Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Nah. <= deserved it. I forgot why bur it’s not important. (the music starts) Come on. Dance with me. I‘11 show you what you missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix dances with Felice. Oscar dances with Blanche. Hannah dances with Bruce. Others get up to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party’s been going for a while. Felix is dancing with Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Dad, the silver tray is gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: So are you.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: And Bruce told me what you gave him. That is so generous.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I wish it was ten times that much. Because I’ve got the most beautiful woman at the party. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: The second most beautiful. (sees Felice dancing with an attractive man) Oh, oh. Competition.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I know her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 223 124 aid. CONTINUED: i

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: She‘s your mother-in-law’s sister. Now your aunt-in-iaw... Could aiso be your new step-mother.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Good. xXeep it in the family. Bruce taps Felix on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (to Felix) Felice wants you to rescue her.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: She said that? Felice nods =o him. Felix gives Hannah to Bruce, then crosses and taps Felice’s PARTNER on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: May 1? .

dialogues.speaker: PARTNER
dialogues.text: You again? You've tapped me out six times.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Sorry. You know how husbands are about their wives.

dialogues.speaker: PARTNER
dialogues.text: That's news to me. I'm her cousin. Felice laughs and sne dances off with Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is almost over. The band is playing some mellow oldie as a few couples remain, some still dancing. Blanche, Frances and their husbands at a table having a final champagne. Hannah talking to her bridesmaids. Oscar and Bruce sitting on the steps of the porch.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (looking at Hannah} Isn‘t she incredible, Pop? Oscar nods, then takes out an envelope. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Bruce, I have something here for you and Hannah,

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Pop, before you do that, I know you're strapped for cash. Just the gesture is enough for Hannah and me.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Who's strapped. I don't spend any money. The ladies in my poker game fill up my freezer every week. I have chicken soup ice cubes... What I have here is not cash... Please take it. Bruce takes it and opens it. He takes out three baseball cards, looking a little worn.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Baseball cards? Great. You know I always saved them.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Not these. I've had these since before you were born. First editions, signed by Joe DiMaggio. Mickey Mantle, rookie year and Babe Ruth in his last year... Today they're worth about twenty-two thousand.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: No way, Pop. I can't take them.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Then hold them for me. Until your kids are eighteen. It'll buy them a few weeks in college.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (moved) ...You're the greatest, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I know, but it only comes out once in awhile... I'm tired. Walk me in. They get up, walk towards the house. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124 125 126 112, ; CONTINUED: (2) ind

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: No chance of your moving out here?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: To where? Santa Yocinta Malinta Calienta Malaguena? I'm not gonna learn a new language just to find my way home at night... They keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: THE PARTY
dialogues.text: The only ones left dancing to the music of the remaining Pianist is Bruce and Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big double bed. Oscar is already in bed. Felix, in the bathroom, is singing ‘Everything's Coming Up Roses'... Th light goes out and he comes out wearing fresh pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Oooh, it feels good to have clean pajamas on again... I am going to sleep my little toesies off tonight. Felix gets into bed, wriggles around, annoying Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God, what a wedding. And I'm so glad the kids loved the silver tray.... You never told me what you gave them, Os. Now that it's any of my business.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I gave them baseball cards.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Really? You think they're going to have time to play cards on their honeymoon?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Felix, tomorrow night I'm going to be sleeping in my own bed. It's not a great bed but I love it. Because it never talks during the night.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's just that, well... it might be another seventeen years before we see each other again.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Good. We'll make it a date. Look, the bus leaves for the L.A. airport at nine in the morning. I want to get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Oh. Didn't I tell you? No bus. Leece is hiring a limo to get us all to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Leece? Who's Leece?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Felice. But I started calling her Leece and she liked it.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Really? What does she call you? Lix?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Oh. Something else. I'm not going back to New York yet. I'm going to stay up in San Fran for a while.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: San Fran??... Lix and Leece in San Fran?... What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Who knows? May stay a few days, may stay forever... We really hit it off tonight, Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I've heard you say that before.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Well, this may be the Jast time you ever hear me say it.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Good. I hope so. I really do. Well, I'm exhausted... G.N. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar, Felix and Felice enter the terminal. Oscar looks at his ticket.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I'm at Gate 46. Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: FELICE
dialogues.text: That's down at that end. We're at the other end. Oscar nods. There is a moment of awkwardness, of how to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: FELICE
dialogues.text: Felix, I'll change your ticket. Give you and Oscar a chance to say goodbye .

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: What?... Oh. Yeah. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: FELICE
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Oscar. Have a wonderful flight.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: And the same to you, Leece. She smiles and walks away to the counter. Oscar and Felix alone, still wondering what to say.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--So where you gonna live? With her? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: No. Of course not... She has a little guest house in the back.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: She looks like she has a lot of dogs. You're going to be walking a lot of dogs, Felix.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: You think I'm making a mistake?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I don't give that advice twice on the same weekend.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: It could be my last chance, Os. I just want to give it a try. Oscar nods.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, if it doesn't work, I'll just go back to my old life... whatever that was.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I wish you the best, Felix.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Of course my best doesn't always mean much.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: It does to me. He puts his arms around Oscar, embraces, his cheek to Oscar's cheek. He holds on.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Okay, that's enough... Felix, stop. She'll think you and I had something going. Felix pulls away, then turns and goes quickly.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH UP 129
dialogues.text: We see Oscar walking in his direction and Felix and Felic in the opposite direction. Felix turns and gives Oscar one last look, then continues on.  lis. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is bright, shining down on Sarasota, Florida. We see the palm trees on the way down, then the exterior of Oscar's Condo, at night. We move in towards the window. The poker game is in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual guests. Abe, Hattie, Esther, Millie, Wanda and Flossie. Oscar is putting some food down on the poker table.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Who gets the bagel with the tofu cream cheese?

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: That's mine.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: And the soy bean facsimile corned beef sandwich?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: That's me... This doesn't have salt, does it?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Just a tinge. But the box said it expired two years ago, it's safe.

dialogues.speaker: FLOSSIE
dialogues.text: Are you in this game, Oscar?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm in for twenty cents.

dialogues.speaker: FLOSSIE
dialogues.text: You didn't look at your cards.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: At these prices, I'll take the plunge.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: (struggles with fork and cake) This cheesecake is hard as a rock.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: That's the wax model they keep in the window. If you like the way it leoks, I'll order it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ESTHER
dialogues.text: So tell us about the wedding. What did you serve?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (sits, looks at cards) Veal Alphonso.

dialogues.speaker: ESTHER
dialogues.text: How do they make it?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: A guy named Alphonso comes in early. The DOORBELL RINGS. Oscar gets up.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll get it. I ordered pizza.

dialogues.speaker: HATTIE
dialogues.text: For tonight?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: No. From before the wedding. I forgot to cancel it. He opens it. A forlorn looking Felix stands there.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Hi, Os... I was in the neighborhood so I thought I'd drop in.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR,
dialogues.text: What a surprise. (looks over his shoulder) Is Felice with you?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: No. It didn't work out. The woman left her clothes all over the floor, always ran out of towels, bobby pins in the bed. I just couldn't hack it... Am I disturbing you?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: No. No. Come on in. Felix goes back into the hall, gets two heavy suitcases and brings them in the apartment. Oscar looks at suitcases suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (to ladies) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Girls, I'd like you to meet the father of the bride, Felix Ungar... Felix, these are my poker buddies.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Gee, I hope I'm not interrupting the game. The women smiles, a little flirtatiously.

dialogues.speaker: HATTIE
dialogues.text: No. My goodness, not at all.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: It's a distinct pleasure to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: ESTHER
dialogues.text: (squints) I can't see him. Is he cute?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Girls, can you excuse us for one minute? Felix, can we have a word inside? As they leave, the women buzz like bees with their heads over the table. All except Abe.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What's with the suitcases?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I gave up my apartment in New York.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: To live in Sarasota?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: They have hospitals here too, you know

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Are you planning to move in with me again, Felix? Because it didn't work the last time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: No, no. Just till I get my om Place... Although we could save a lot of money splitting expenses.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Nothing's changed, Felix. I'm still a pig and you're still a human vacuum cleaner.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I know... Look, if you don't think it would work, just say ‘no'.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: ‘Not! Felix looks at him, nods.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Okay... So I'll go. He starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (watches him) +..I didn't say 'go'. I said ‘no’... Alright, we'll try it for a few weeks. But the minute you try matching up my socks, we call it quits.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (smiles) It's a deal... Go on. Go back to your game. I'll get my bags and hang up a few things. Oscar leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MILLIE
dialogues.text: He looks so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: HATTIE
dialogues.text: If he's looking, I've got a spare bedroom I don't use. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Ladies, it's possible that in five weeks you'll @all move out of Sarasota, Florida... Whose bet is it? Felix comes out, his jacket is off.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Don't mind me, folks. Just going to get a beer. (looks down) Oh. Is this your napkin? (picks it up, gives it to Esther) :+-That sandwich looks a little limp. I could retoast it for you in a second.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Really? I wouldn't mind.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: No trouble at all. He picks up the plate and goes off into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: This is the biggest goddamndest Deja Vu anyone ever had... Can we play cards, please? The game resumes as the CAMERA PULLS BACK, slowly out of the room, out of the house, into Sarasota, still on the game... FADE OUT.
